intro: Coreopsis aristulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking low-maintenance, drought-tolerant plants. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
